Installing the latest build Aperi-incubation-R04-071110-235151.zip on Linux platform, the install completed successfully but there was an error showed after execution of dos2unix - /usr/bin/find: missing argument to `-exec'

1. It is still needed to run dos2unix manually to make all the "*.sh" scripts work

In order to start servers/agents after the install, I need to manually do the following steps:

1. chmod a+x for install, datasvr.sh, reporting.sh & AperiRcpGui
2. cd /aperi and issue
   find . -name "*.sh" -exec dos2unix {} \; -print
3. change @variable to .. for the following export command in datasvr.sh devsvr.sh & agent.sh
   export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="@variable/lib/linux-ix86:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH"
4. modified the following export statement in reporting.sh
   export PATH=/aperi/install/../lib/linux-ix86;$PATH  as
   export PATH=/aperi/install/../lib/linux-ix86:$PATH

not getting the stack traces anymore... don't know what caused it.  Never able to reproduce.  

not sure what you meant below in regards to reporting.sh?  Don't see a desired change.  

other .sh files should be resolved now (in terms of the variable).  

you'll still need to run the 'find' command.

The status of the latest build Aperi-incubation-R04-071114-220126.zip as follows:

1. chmod a+x for install, datasvr.sh, reporting.sh & AperiRcpGui
not fixed yet

2. cd /aperi and issue
   find . -name "*.sh" -exec dos2unix {} \; -print
this step is required after install 

3. change @variable to .. for the following export command in datasvr.sh
devsvr.sh & agent.sh
   export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="@variable/lib/linux-ix86:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH"
It is fixed in the build

4. modified the following export statement in reporting.sh
   export PATH=/aperi/install/../lib/linux-ix86;$PATH  as
   export PATH=/aperi/install/../lib/linux-ix86:$PATH
without changing ; to : for the above PATH statement, received the following error message running reporting.sh script
./reporting.sh: line4:/aperi/install/../lib/linux-ix86: is a directory.

It seems we don't need the above PATH statement to run reporting.sh
